input_text:
Job Title: Senior IT Project Manager

Location: Greater Phoenix Area

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Information Technology, Project Management

Description:
It's fun to work in a company where people truly believe in what they are doing. At Dutch Bros Coffee, we are more than just a coffee company. We are a fun-loving, mind-blowing company that makes a difference one cup at a time. 
Position OverviewThe Senior IT Project Manager is responsible for leading and managing complex IT projects from start to finish. This position will work closely with cross-functional teams, including developers, engineers, QA analysts, designers, and business stakeholders, to ensure project objectives are met within scope, budget, and timeline. All activities will be performed in support of the strategy, vision, and values of Dutch Bros.
Location Requirement: This position is based in Phoenix, AZ and is not eligible for remote work. ﻿
Key Result Areas (KRAs)Ensures that a portfolio of projects are executed efficiently and effectively, with a focus on delivering projects on time, within budget, and to the satisfaction of stakeholder:Be outcome and benefit driven, identifying and realizing benefits and, prioritizing project delivery to meet business priorities.Understand client requirements and have the ability to design comprehensive strategies for achieving successful project outcomes.Collaborate with stakeholders to clarify project requirements to build statements of work.Communicate project progress, risks, and issues to stakeholders, and ensure that stakeholders are informed and engaged throughout the project lifecycle.Manage project budgets, including forecasting and tracking project costs, and ensuring that projects are resourced appropriately to deliver on time and within budget.Ensure compliance with organizational policies and standards, including security and data privacy requirements.Coordinate project testing, deployment, and post-implementation activities, ensuring successful project delivery and that lessons learned are applied to future projects.
Collaborate with IT staff and project stakeholders to effectively communicate project expectations and status in a timely and concise manner:Develop and deliver presentations to key stakeholders as needed.Participate in the strategic planning activities for the assigned area.Hold and/or attend regular project status meetings, vendor presentations, and teleconferences associated with assigned projects.Develop strong partnerships and work with peer levels of management to resolve resource conflicts.Negotiate and manage vendor contracts, ensuring that contract terms and conditions are fair, clear, and enforceable and that vendors are held accountable for meeting their contractual obligations.Mentor and train junior project managers and provide guidance and support to project team members
Champion continuous improvement in project management processes and practices, and ensure compliance with organizational policies and standards: Work with business partners to optimize cross-departmental processes and improve system automation to scale workflows.Identify and implement relevant tools and technologies that can help streamline project management processes and improve project outcomes.Champion a culture of continuous improvement within the project management team, encouraging team members to share ideas and feedback.Assess and benchmark project management practices against industry standards and best practices to identify areas for improvement.Communicate effectively and independently across the organization at the executive level and outside the organization.Work through and escalate issues that serve as roadblocks and/or place project objectives at risk. 
Job QualificationsBachelor’s degree in business management, computer science, or related field 6 additional years of experience in IT project management, with a proven track record of delivering complex projects on time and within budgetStrong technical background in IT infrastructure, including knowledge of network architecture, server infrastructure, cloud technologies, cybersecurity, and IT operationsExperience implementing IT infrastructure solutions, including network topologies, storage solutions, and server configurations, while considering scalability and securityExperience in managing software development projects for applications released through app stores such as Google Play or the Apple App storeExperience managing vendors for IT projects, including selecting vendors, negotiating contracts, and ensuring that vendors deliver their services on time and within budgetExperience in managing change, including creating change management processes and communicating changes to stakeholders, minimizing the impact of change to business operationsKnowledge of project management methodologies, including agile, waterfall, and hybrid approachesExperience using project management tools and software, such as Jira, Trello, or WrikePMP certification or equivalent

SkillsChange ManagementCollaborationCommunicationFinancial ManagementLeadershipPresentationsProject ManagementRisk ManagementStakeholder ManagementTechnical Knowledge
Physical RequirementsOccasionally move or lift office items Must be able to work in an office environment Must be able to communicate in an effective manner to perform job dutiesConstantly operates a computer and other office productivity machinery, such as calculators, copy machines, computers, and office equipment
If you like wild growth and working in a unique and fun environment, surrounded by positive community, you'll enjoy your career with us!

Experience Level (if available): None

output_json.title: Senior IT Project Manager
output_json.summary: Lead and manage complex IT projects, ensuring objectives are met within scope, budget, and timeline.
job_responsibilities: Ensures efficient and effective execution of a portfolio of projects
Delivers projects on time, within budget, and to stakeholder satisfaction
Understands client requirements and designs comprehensive strategies for successful project outcomes
Collaborates with stakeholders to clarify project requirements
Communicates project progress, risks, and issues to stakeholders
Ensures compliance with organizational policies and standards
Coordinates project testing, deployment, and post-implementation activities
Mentors and trains junior project managers
Champions continuous improvement in project management processes
Assesses and benchmarks project management practices
output_json.physical_requirements: Occasionally move or lift office items. Must be able to work in an office environment. Must be able to communicate in an effective manner to perform job duties.

other.content: Bachelor’s degree in business management, computer science, or related field; 6 additional years of experience in IT project management; strong technical background in IT infrastructure; experience implementing IT infrastructure solutions; experience managing software development projects; experience managing vendors; experience in managing change; knowledge of project management methodologies; experience using project management tools; PMP certification or equivalent
